cscie97.asn4.housemate.entitlement

Class Credentials

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie97.asn4.housemate.entitlement.Credentials

  • public class Credentials
extends java.lang.Object
    User objects may have multiple sets of credentials; a Credential essentially consists of the username and password combination that a User will use to login and logout of the IEntitlementServiceAPI, which will create an AccessToken that they may use to carry out restricted interface methods. Users may then have multiple sets of usernames/passwords that they can use to log into the system. Passwords are hashed using the helper class PasswordHash. At no time are the actual plain-text passwords stored on the object; only the password hash is saved on the object.
    See Also:
    User, AccessToken, PasswordHash

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getPasswordHash()
      The hashed version of the password
      java.lang.String getPasswordSalt()
      The salt used when hashing the password; required for later verifying the user password so that a new hashed password can be generated and compared to the current hashed password
      java.lang.String getUsername()
      Returns the username
      void setPasswordHash(java.lang.String passwordHash)
      Sets the hashed version of the password; note that this does not perform the actual hashing, that is done in the class constructor.
      void setPasswordSalt(java.lang.String passwordSalt)
      Sets the salt value used to hash the password.
      void setUsername(java.lang.String username)
      Sets the username

    • Constructor Detail

      • Credentials

        public Credentials(java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password)
        Class constructor. Takes a username and password, hashes the password, and saves the hashed version and the salt used to generate the hash.
        Parameters:
        username - the username that is to be used
        password - the plain-text password; will be hashed and saved (the plain-text version is never saved)

        public void setPasswordHash(java.lang.String passwordHash)

        Parameters:

      • getPasswordSalt

        public java.lang.String getPasswordSalt()
        The salt used when hashing the password; required for later verifying the user password so that a new hashed password can be generated and compared to the current hashed password
        Returns:
        the salt used to create the original hashed password

      • setPasswordSalt

        public void setPasswordSalt(java.lang.String passwordSalt)
        Sets the salt value used to hash the password.
        Parameters:
        passwordSalt - sets the salt value to hash the password
